key_points: Twin blasts at Kabul's airport killed dozens of Afghan civilians and at least 13 US soldiers.
General Kenneth McKenzie confirmed 13 US service members were killed and 15 injured.
President Joe Biden committed to continuing evacuations and vowed revenge against ISIS.
Intelligence warnings had indicated a terror threat from the Islamic State.
The explosions occurred outside Hamid Karzai International Airport's Abbey Gate and the nearby Baron Hotel.
Taliban condemned the attack and cited the presence of foreign forces as a cause for such incidents.
Emergency NGO reported 60 injured individuals arriving at their Kabul Surgical Center, with six dead on arrival.
German, UK, and French leaders condemned the attack and expressed condolences.
German Defense Minister Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer announced all German troops had left Afghanistan.
UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres called for an emergency Security Council meeting in response.
spokespersons: General Kenneth McKenzie (Commander, US Central Command)
